text:
How are people handling event listings with HubDB? For example; displaying them on a homepage but need to have them sorted by date, but the date is a range so we are using a text field rather than the date field. Is it possible to do this? And is it possible to set how many we want to pull from the database? I assume it is.

As a separate question; on an actual Events page, can you have 2 sections; One for Upcoming and one for Past; and then have some query that looks at the date range and today's date and based on that it populates the list below each header?
I can add date ranges as a new column type :eyes:
How would you expect these values to be sorted? By starting date?
that would be awesome if that was a type. I ended up using 2 date time fields for when i did this
Shouldnâ€™t be too hard to implement on my end.
<@U26C29XPH> if you check out <@U3A4KEWK1>'s example of paging and what he did for a resources page you can follow the same suit: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PDRW72/p1498753236477058>
at that point, its just a matter of having a dynamic table setup for dynamic pages (thats how I did it) and then having a start date column and end date column
using the `limit` line is where i was to add other params like `&orderBy=startDateTime`
<@U6GNQ7JBU> that would be awesome! Then we could show/hide based on start date or end dates.
Dates are just timestamps underneath so you can use gt, lt, etc to filter them.
